p: Perceived Hygiene Effectiveness Perceived effectiveness of hygiene measures for preventing A/H5N1/A/H1N1 was assessed with two items asking respondents about their beliefs in the effectiveness (completely ineffective/somewhat ineffective/unsure/somewhat effective/highly effective) of washing hands before touching face or food and of washing hands after going out (Appendix TableÂ 1). In both surveys, all factor loadings exceeded 0.87.
